docs.snippet: Using video cameras, still cameras, audio recorders, social media and plain old notebooks, we hear the voices of a city in pain.

headline.print_headline: How One Brutal Weekend in Chicago Lives on for Times Team
headline.main: How One Brutal Weekend in Chicago Lives on for Times Team

docs.snippet: Armed with mobile phones, young people across Nigeria are turning to social media to discuss and report cases of female genital mutilation (FGM) in a country where a quarter of girls and women have been cut, activists said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Nigeria's Youth Turn to Social Media to Report FGM: Activists
headline.main: Nigeria's Youth Turn to Social Media to Report FGM: Activists

docs.snippet: Drake earned a record-breaking 13 American Music Awards nominations on Monday thanks to his latest album, "Views," shattering Michael's Jackson's mark of 11 nominations in a single year from 1984 when the King of Pop had "Thriller."

headline.print_headline: Drake Shatters American Music Awards Nominations Record
headline.main: Drake Shatters American Music Awards Nominations Record

docs.snippet: Readers react to recent reviews of David France’s “How to Survive a Plague,” John Lewis’s “March Trilogy” and more.
Tuesday: A day of generosity, new heights for “Hamilton” and local flights to Cuba.
Donovan, who retired two years ago at age 32, said a joking suggestion from a Los Angeles Galaxy official would become reality. The team said he could play on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Soccer; At 34, Donovan to End Retirement
headline.main: Landon Donovan Will End Retirement and Return to M.L.S.

docs.abstract: Former Los Angeles Galaxy midfielder Landon Donovan announces that he is coming out of retirement to help Galaxy win its sixth Major League Soccer championship.

docs.snippet: When she first posted a message on Twitter, Kelly Oxford, a social media powerhouse, didn’t expect many replies. She got millions.

headline.print_headline: ‘Tweet Me Your First Assaults’ Sets Off a Protest Movement
headline.main: For Many Women, Trump’s ‘Locker Room Talk’ Brings Memories of Abuse

docs.abstract: Request by author Kelly Oxford on Twitter for women to tweet their experiences with sexual assault in response to release of recording of Donald Trump talking about forcing himself on women leads to overwhelming response; Facebook pages and Twitter feeds immediately fill with comments and multiplying threads from women, many who claim they had never spoken about their abuse before, retelling harrowing experiences of sexual assault, harassment and other forms of abuse.

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Donald Trump, Ohio State University, ‘Hamilton’: Your Tuesday Briefing

docs.snippet: A&T will stop giving consumers replacement Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphones because of reports that some of the replacement phones are catching fire, just as the original phones did before they were recalled last month.

headline.print_headline: AT&T Stops Samsung Phone Exchanges After New Fire Reports
headline.main: AT&T Stops Samsung Phone Exchanges After New Fire Reports

docs.snippet: A former state lawmaker charged with trying to lure a 14-year-old girl into a sexual encounter also smoked marijuana in the Statehouse and sold the drug to several other legislators, but there wasn't enough evidence to charge them with drug crimes...

headline.print_headline: Prosecutor: Legislators Bought Marijuana From Then-Colleague
headline.main: Prosecutor: Legislators Bought Marijuana From Then-Colleague
